page.title: 20AN OLD MAN'S VIEW
page.content: Mr Murrel has lived in Cippenham for 50 years.In his younger days it was a village.Recently he has noticed a rise in house building and the population. Small grocery stores have vanished. The Herald Snooker Club on the Bath Road was a Cinema and Dance Hall -The Commodore. The development of houses was mainly due to Mr.Iona who built many houses by extending St.Andrew's Way.Prices have changed a lot in the last 40 years..In the late 1940's a newspaper cost 1d (1/2p) Petrol cost 3s 6d under 20p a gallon.Bus fares from Cippenham to Slough cost 6d (2p) In 1960 fish and chips cost 1s 9d(10p) The Trading Estate, the largest in Europe,helps Slough with unemployment and people live in Cippenham to work on the Trading Estate.Mr Murrel feels that all that is left of the old Cippenham is round the Village Green.
